poem:
**The Marvel of Currency**

Pixels flicker, men in masks  
Dance in empire's machine,  
Green paper whispers  
Beneath heavy cinema shades.  
Heroes swathed in silver screens,  
The dollar's eternal dream—  
Cogs in Disney's relentless reel,  
Our myths for sale.  
   
Counting starlit threads,  
We weave more tales,  
A tapestry of gold.  
   
Untangle them, lovers of wonder.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Is this really the end of the line for Deadpool? Disney will never turn off the money tap As Deadpool & Wolverine is about to hit $1bn at the global box office this weekend, the question Disney suits will no doubt be asking themselves is whether there’s more wonga to be made here. Just about everybody expected Ryan Reynolds’s debut in the Marvel Cinematic Universe to be a success, but few could have imagined that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
